*** Bug 64021 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

You're not giving much detail about what you try to do, but I think what you are
looking for in the Debug view. You can open it using window>show
view>other...>debug>debug, or open the debug perspective window>open perspective.
And check help>help content>java dev user guide>getting started.

If this doesn't solve your problem, please give more detail about what you are
trying to do.

My Debugger used to work fine, suddenly its not working.  Know how to use the 
debugger.  For some reason its not showing the running threads, rather not 
able to debug it.

When I see the netstat my JVM is listerning on the port I have specified and 
eclipse debugger is established the connect, still I am not able to see the 
thread monitor and step through using F5 or F6.

Any help will be appreciated.

What version of Eclipse are you using? Did you manually close the "threads & 
monitors" view? Can you re-open it, and/or the debug view? If you are using 
version 3.0, you may have the "show system threads" filter turned off (see 
drop down menu in the debug view), which would hide system threads.

I am using Eclipse version 2.1.2.

Trying to debug my local weblogic 5.1 instance on port xxxx as Remote java 
applications.

I am seeing blank screen, even though it connects to my remote java 
application using connection type Standard (Socket Attach) Host localhost 
port: 7777

Sometime back I have changed the my host file changed the 127.0.0.1 loop back 
address to localhost.mydomain.com  but changed it back to localhost, but still 
no luck.  I am sure its connecting to remote java application, but somehow its 
not showing the Threads and Monitors. Because of that I could not debug or 
step through.

Any thoughts. If I reinstall eclipse or debug plugin will it solve the problem.

Thanks in advance.
Kathir

The Debug View is not open - it drives all other views (i.e the selection in 
the debug view provides context for other debug views). Window > Show View  > 
Debug.

The debug view should be opened automatically when a breakpoint is hit. Did you know for certain if your 
application hit a breakpoint?
(this is 2.1.2, the debug view does *not* open automatically).
